title.rendered: Rooms For Rent In Pasadena, LA

content.rendered:
Pasadena is a city in California, northeast of downtown Los Angeles. In the center, Old Pasadena is a shopping and dining district known for its Victorian and art deco buildings. If you’re considering moving to a new city; Roomi will help you find rooms for rent in Pasadena, LA. You’ll find a lot of opportunities to explore this amazing city. We’ll be your guide from getting around the city to exploring cheap rooms for rent in Pasadena, LA!

Getting to know Pasadena

The city features a plethora of festivals and events, as well as college campuses. Pasadena combines world class events, science and technology, arts and culture, history and architecture with good neighborhoods and opportunities for all. This makes it a great place to find rooms for rent in Pasadena, LA. Come along for the ride as we show you all the things you need to know to live in this fun-filled city.

Find rooms for rent in Pasadena, LA

Find Rooms For Rent In Pasadena, LA

Neighborhoods with cheap rooms for rent in Pasadena, LA are Historic Highlands, where the average rent goes for $1,717/month and Bungalow Heaven, where renters pay $2,005/mo on average. Madison Heights, where the average rent goes for $2,110/mo.

If you’re looking for other great deals with cheap rooms for rent in Pasadena, LA- check out Oak Knoll ($2,110), Casa Grande ($2,119), and Daisy – Villa ($2,221), where the asking prices are below the average Pasadena rent of $2,428/mo.

Related: 5 Minimalist Bedroom Wall Art Ideas You Need In Your Life

Top Neighborhoods in Pasadena

There are a total of 9 Pasadena neighborhoods. The neighborhood with the highest Livability Score is East Central and the largest neighborhood by population is North Central.

East Central

The neighborhood of East Central has a population of around 20,000. Beautiful weather, lower than average crime rates, good schools, and stable housing and rental markets are some of the many reasons why East Central is a great neighborhood. The Pasadena Farmers Market, offer residents a variety of options for shopping and personal needs. The city’s public transportation system also runs through the neighborhood and offers users various convenient stops. All this makes East Central a great place to look for rooms for rent in Pasadena, LA.

Oak Knoll

Oak Knoll was developed in the 1920s, as part of a partnership between A. Kinsley Macomber, Henry E. Huntington and William R. Staats. Homes here were designed in the Bungalow style, but developers wanted the area to have an artisan flair. So they brought in some of the top architects in the country, including Greene & Greene and Myron Hunt. The homes in this Pasadena neighborhood are renowned for their beauty, and many are one-of-a-kind houses.

South Arroyo

Located in the heart of Pasadena, south of the stadium, is the popular neighborhood of South Arroyo. This neighborhood offers residents a variety of luxury condominiums besides rental rooms to choose from. Several famous landmarks are located in this neighborhood including Eagle Rock Historical Landmark and the Pasadena Community Gardens. The Shops on the Lake Avenue is in close proximity to this neighborhood as well.

Average rent in Pasadena, LA

University life in Pasadena

If you’re looking for cheap rooms for rent in Pasadena, LA, while pursuing your studies, Roomi will help make the process easier. Here are the top 5 universities to check out!

  • University of Southern California
  • California Institute of Technology
  • ArtCenter College of Design
  • Pasadena City College
  • Los Angeles College of Music

Here’s the breakdown of the cost of living in Pasadena, LA.

Cost of Living

Related: Tips On How To Save Money For Everyone

How transit-friendly is Pasadena?

I don’t drive at all, and live south of Colorado. I can walk to anything I need in about 10-15 mins and everything outside of that isn’t much further. The local buses are great and cheap. Pasadena is extremely livable without a car if you’re not far from Colorado. Bonus perk, walking everywhere has been excellent for my mental health. – @worrymonster via Reddit

1. Public Transportation

South Pasadena is served by the Metro Gold Line and Metro Bus systems. Transit schedules and updates are available at the Metro website. Each bus ride costs 75 cents per passenger, visitors can pay using exact change on-board, bus drivers do not carry cash to make change. Riders can also use TAP Cards to pay for fare.

2. Walkability

Pasadena has an average Walk Score of 69, with 137,122 residents. When you’re looking for rooms for rent in Pasadena, LA – walking is the best option! The most walkable Pasadena neighborhoods are South Lake, Downtown and Raymond Hill.

3. Migo App

Pasadena is a surprisingly easy city to get around without a car. There are 86 ways to get around Pasadena, California, and 61 of the best ways are available through Migo! Choose between 11 carshare, 17 taxi, 20 rideshare, bikeshare, or 34 black car/limo companies. Whether you need the closest, cheapest, or fastest ride, Migo has all of them in one app. Uber/Lyft are also a convenient option.

4. Bikes

With a bike score of 70, designated bike lanes and Roseways can be found on many Pasadena streets. In fact, over 12 miles of connector and arterial roadways in Pasadena have bikeways. Pasadena also offers parking for over 1,000 bicycles in the form of bicycle racks at bus stops, city-owned parking lots, churches, private office garages, local business and apartment buildings.

Related: Rules To Set In Apartments For Rent With Roommates

Fun activities to do in Pasadena

Pasadena is known for its New Year’s Day Rose Parade and Rose Bowl Game. It’s an upscale community with a thriving arts, cultural and entertainment scene and lots of great places to eat and shop centered around Old Town Pasadena. You can even nourish your love for the arts at the first-rate events and museums.

Hiking, biking and other outdoor activities are alive and well in Pasadena. Surrounded by the San Gabriel Mountains, residents here have access to tons of trails, which are usually less crowded than their cousins in central LA. At the Eaton Canyon Nature Preserve, you can enjoy 190 acres of gorgeous SoCal wildlife, or hike to the Eaton Canyon Falls, where you can wade in a pool at the bottom of a 40-ft. waterfall.

Restaurants in Pasadena

Again Cafe and Chibiscus Ramen offers contemporary Asian cuisine, and a dog-friendly patio.

Crepes de Paris serves up French-style Crepes, both sweet and Savory.

And if you’re looking for a romantic evening out, Cafe Santorini’s outdoor patio is open all year-round for couples who want to dine under the stars.

We’ve got you!

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find cheap rooms for rent in Pasadena, LA? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match! Download the app here and hop on the easiest ride home, ever!

Download The App Now
